metadata.title: CVE-2017-7546 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
PostgreSQL versions before 9.2.22, 9.3.18, 9.4.13, 9.5.8 and 9.6.4 arevulnerable to incorrect authentication flaw allowing remote attackers togain access to database accounts with an empty password.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7546` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.3.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libecpg6 - 9.3.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 9.3.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libpq5 - 9.3.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
postgresql-9.3 - 9.3.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
postgresql-client-9.3 - 9.3.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
postgresql-contrib-9.3 - 9.3.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
postgresql-plperl-9.3 - 9.3.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
postgresql-plpython-9.3 - 9.3.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-9.3 - 9.3.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-9.3 - 9.3.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.1: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
postgresql-9.3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.3.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
